comments:
Was attempting to execute an OSGi framework using the jars contained within 
the org.eclipse.osgi plugin, and using the EclispeAdapter.

Command line:
java -Dosgi.configuration.area=file:/c:/data/eclipseosgi/configuration/  -
classpath 
console.jar;core.jar;defaultAdaptor.jar;osgi.jar;resolver.jar;eclipseAdaptor.ja
r org.eclipse.osgi.framework.launcher.Launcher -console -
adaptor:org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseAdaptor "launch"

The (naive) expectation was that this would start successfully (assuming that 
the right set of configuration variables would be defined prior to execution)

However, this results in the following exception:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.LocationManager.getOSGiConfigurationDir
(LocationManager.java:290)
        at 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseAdaptor.initBundleStoreRootDir
(EclipseAdaptor.java:100)
        at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.defaultadaptor.DefaultAdaptor.initialize
(DefaultAdaptor.java:123)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseAdaptor.initialize
(EclipseAdaptor.java:92)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.initialize
(Framework.java:113)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.<init>
(Framework.java:95)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.createFramework
(OSGi.java:90)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.<init>(OSGi.java:31)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.launcher.Launcher.doOSGi
(Launcher.java:312)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.launcher.Launcher.doIt(Launcher.java:134)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.launcher.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:107)

since the LocationManager is not initialized as part of the Adaptor class, but 
rather as part of the EclipseStarter

Therefore, should this be able to start, and if not, then an appropriate error 
message should be the result, rather than a NullPointerException.

A patch would work wonders here.  That way we can understand exactly what you 
want (i.e., there may be more than just the LocationManager)

In 3.1 the framework is now packaged as a single jar and starting it standalone
is working. Closing as FIXED.
